results.title: Students in Berlin
results.brief_description: Shows the Free University of West Berlin and students from all over the world in part-time jobs in the city and at their studies. The history of the Free University, from its establishment by the students themselves to its present prosperous condition, with many fine buildings, numerous research institutes and large self-governing student body.

results.title: Student nurse
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Screen Services and Francis Searle
results.brief_description: The story of a trainee nurse in Great Britain, from the time she is a probationer in a training hospital until the time she is a fully-qualified State-registered nurse. In hospital wards, laboratories, operating theatres, and lecture-rooms, she acquires during her years of training technical knowledge and practical skills.

results.title: Student activity: a case study on Dial-a-Bus
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Open University and David Nelson
results.brief_description: Looks at two Dial-a-Bus schemes, run by London Country Bus Services, and one in Manchester based on an agreement between Greater Manchester Transport, a public body, and Godfrey Abbot Ltd, a private bus contractor.

results.title: Stuck on a hot roof
results.creator_credit: Tay Li Nar and School of Creative Media RMIT
results.brief_description: CD-ROM completed as part of Major Project in second year of RMIT Bachelor of Arts in Multimedia. Inspired by the conventional comic strip’s linear format the work attempts to both work within and reinforce the conventions of a left to right frame sequenvce as well as explore the possibilities of breaking these parameters. This prototype interactive comic strip allows for multiple narratives and breaks the sequence to create variable storylines. Suitable for most age groups; contains low level offensive language.

results.title: Stuart Little (Collector's edition) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Jason Clark, Jeff Franklin II, Steve Waterman and Rob Minkoff
results.brief_description: When his parents want to adopt another child, George Little begs them to bring him home a little brother, however he is surprised when they bring home a mouse who they name Stuart. George resents the intrusion into his family by a mouse, until a model boat race in Central Park draws the two brothers together. Unfortunately, the family cat Snowbell finds the temptation to eat the new family member unbearable and will not rest until Stuart is out of his life. Based on the story by E.B. White. Features the voices of Michael J. Fox, Nathan Lane, Jennifer Tilly and Bruno Kirby.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Columbia Pictures, Jason Clark, Jeff Franklin II, Steve Waterman and Rob Minkoff

results.title: Struggle for Pedder
results.brief_description: Beginning with an aggressive argument in favour of flooding Lake Pedder this film, supporting the conservation of the lake, shows through the eyes of a photographer, botanist, artist, zoologist, poet and others, something of the beauty and interest residing in the lake and its surroundings.
